SCSSdkClient.​Object.​SCSTelemetry.​Truck.​Current.​Motor.​Gear
public
SCSSdkClient.​Object.​SCSTelemetry.​Truck.​Current.​Motor.​Gear

Slected Gear, HShifter... etc.

Information
HShifterSlot

0 means that no slot is selected

Gear
- > 0

Forward gears

-  0

Neutral

- < 0

Reverse gears

Properties

public uint HShifterSlot { get; internal set }

Gearbox slot the h-shifter handle is currently in.

public int Selected { get; internal set }

Selected gear in the engine

public bool[] HShifterSelector { get; internal set }

Enabled state of range/splitter selector toggles

SCSSdkClient.​Object.​SCSTelemetry.​Truck.​Current.​Motor.​Brakes
public
SCSSdkClient.​Object.​SCSTelemetry.​Truck.​Current.​Motor.​Brakes

Brake Values

Information
RetarderLevel

<0;max> where 0 is disabled retarder and max is maximal value found in Truck configuration See Also: Constants.Motor.RetarderStepCount <summary> Current level of the retarder </summary> <!----> **INFORMATION** <!----> 0;max where 0 is disabled retarder and max is maximal value found in TRUCK configuration <!----> **INFORMATION** <!----> <seealso cref="Constants.Motor.RetarderStepCount" />.

Properties

SCSSdkClient.​Object.​SCSTelemetry.​Truck.​Current.​Lights
public
SCSSdkClient.​Object.​SCSTelemetry.​Truck.​Current.​Lights

Lightlevel and state of Lights

Information
Blinker Avtive

This represents the logical enable state of the blinker. It it is true as long the blinker is enabled regardless of the physical enabled state of the light (i.e. it does not blink and ignores enable state of electric).

SCSSdkClient.​Object.​SCSTelemetry.​Truck.​Current.​Wheels
public
SCSSdkClient.​Object.​SCSTelemetry.​Truck.​Current.​Wheels

States of the Wheels

Information
Velocity

Positive velocity corresponds to forward movement

Steering

Value is from <0.25,0.25> range in counterclockwise direction when looking from top (e.g. 0.25 corresponds to left and -0.25 corresponds to right)

Set to zero for non-steered wheels

Rotation

Value is from <0.0,1.0) range in which value increase corresponds to forward movement

Lift

For use with simple lifted/ non-lifted test or logical visualization of the lifting progress.

  • Value of 0 corresponds to non-lifted axle.

  • Value of 1 corresponds to fully lifted axle.  Set to zero or not provided for non-liftable axles.

LiftOffset

Might have non-linear relation to lift ratio.  Set to zero or not provided for non-liftable axles.

Properties
Substance
public uint[] Substance { get; internal set }

Substance below the wheel

SuspDeflection
public float[] SuspDeflection { get; internal set }

Vertical displacement of the wheel from its axis in meters

Velocity
public float[] Velocity { get; internal set }

Angular velocity of the wheel in rotations per second

Steering
public float[] Steering { get; internal set }

Steering rotation of the wheel in rotations

Rotation
public float[] Rotation { get; internal set }

Rolling rotation of the wheel in rotations

Lift
public float[] Lift { get; internal set }

Lift state of the wheel <0;1>

LiftOffset
public float[] LiftOffset { get; internal set }

Vertical displacement of the wheel axle from its normal position in meters as result of lifting.

OnGround
public bool[] OnGround { get; internal set }

Is the wheel in contact with ground?
